title: Getting Around the City
description: Read about different ways to navigate a new city.

passage.text:
Visiting a new city can be exciting but also confusing. Here are some tips to help you get around easily.

First, get a good map. You can use a map app on your smartphone, or pick up a paper map at a tourist information center. Map apps are very useful because they can show you where you are and give you directions in real-time.

Second, learn some basic direction words. In English, the most important words are: left, right, straight, turn, next to, opposite, and between. If you know these words, you can understand most directions.

Third, don't be afraid to ask for help. Most people are happy to give directions to visitors. You can start by saying 'Excuse me, I'm looking for...' or 'Can you tell me how to get to...?'

Fourth, look for landmarks. Big buildings, parks, statues, and famous places can help you remember where you are. When someone gives you directions, they often mention landmarks like 'Turn left after the big church' or 'It's opposite the park.'

Finally, take your time. Walking around a new city is the best way to explore and discover interesting places. Don't worry if you get a little lost - sometimes the best discoveries happen by accident!
